Sopal is not just a bistro and wine bar; it\'s a lively hub of flavor and good times! Picture this: a fusion of contemporary cuisine with a local twist, all served up in an atmosphere that\'s as friendly as it is vibrant. They are not just about food and wine; they\'re about creating exceptional experiences that\'ll leave you smiling.\n\nTheir menu dances to the beat of the seasons, celebrating local ingredients cooked up with flair, especially on open-fire grill. It\'s all about sharing the joy, with dishes crafted for friendly gatherings and paired perfectly with a diverse range of wines. Speaking of wines, their bar boasts over 100 labels, shining the spotlight on organic, natural, and biodynamic wonders from the Balkan region and beyond.

A vibrant female-owned spot where law meets culinary flair. Led by a former lawyer turned Michelin-trained chef, it\'s a pet-friendly taco haven crafting fresh delights. With changing menus every few days, Chef Kun≈°tek\'s inventive spirit promises surprises, even pet-sized tacos! Join the fun ‚Äì every visit is a flavorful adventure! üåÆüéâ

Indulge in a unique culinary experience at Sol Tapas, the brainchild of renowned Croatian chef Mate Jankovic. Here, "Croatian tapas" comes to life, celebrating traditional flavors with a fresh, modern twist. With a commitment to using local ingredients, Croatian wines, and reinterpreting classics in tapas style, Sol Tapas invites guests to savor authentic tastes in a casual, vibrant setting. \n\nDiscover the joy of Croatian gastronomy with Mate Jankovic\'s innovative approach, where every dish tells a story of tradition and innovation.

Step into the cozy charm of Kai Street Food, a small eatery run by three friends passionate about global street food. Despite its size, this spot is big on flavor, offering a concise menu focused on quality and affordability. \n\nWatch the chefs at work in the open kitchen, enjoy local craft beers, kombuchas, and an array of drinks. Spice up your meal with complimentary hot sauces ‚Äì at Kai, every bite is a delightful journey into worldwide street food delights!

Nestled in the heart of Masarykova, Bestija is a culinary sanctuary, boasting a coveted Michelin recommendation for the past two years. \n\nThis hidden gem invites food enthusiasts to indulge in carefully crafted, beautifully presented plates inspired by local dishes and ingredients sourced from the nearby market. Soft, smiling, and relaxed, Bestija is a haven of calm amidst the metropolis. Join the ranks of those who have savored its delights, including the likes of Samuel L. Jackson, escaping the city\'s hustle for a taste of culinary excellence.

A one-of-a-kind experience that redefines the aftermath of a night out! Immerse yourself in interactive activities like the "Drunk Driving" simulator and hilarious "Drunk Darts" with beer goggles. Win a free entrance as you enjoy a cold beer while navigating the museum. Test your coordination with drunk walking on a straight line, and explore over 40 items and stories that capture the essence of those unforgettable mornings after. Exclusively located in Zagreb, it\'s the ultimate destination for laughter and shared tales of the morning haze.

The caffe oasis in Zagreb where affordability meets character! This hidden gem offers a range of Croatian beers, coffee, and budget-friendly spirits, making it one of the city\'s least expensive places to enjoy a drink. Dive into a unique atmosphere adorned with fascinating alternative art and bask in the vibrant energy of a large outdoor patio. \n\n Krivi Put is not just a bar; it\'s a self-service haven where everyone feels like a friend. If you\'re a social butterfly, this is your spot. Here, everybody knows everybody ‚Äì whether it\'s a cozy first date or a lively gathering of 20-plus friends, the place buzzes with the charm of diverse encounters. Join the eclectic crowd and make Krivi Put your go-to destination for affordable drinks, captivating art, and memorable connections. üçªüé®‚ú®

AKC Medika is the beating heart of non-mainstream culture in Zagreb! This vibrant social and cultural center, part of the non-partisan AKC association, is a DIY haven since 2009. With two dance floors, an affordable bar serving delightful drinks and pizza, and walls adorned with art and graffiti, Medika is where rebellion meets creativity. \n\n As the bar winds down, the energy flows to the clubs below, where DJs and live music keep the beats alive, spanning punk, metal, house, and techno, and everything else. Medika is not just a space; it\'s a celebration of alternative culture, a place where diverse ideas and expressions thrive. Join the Medika community and be part of a dynamic scene that refuses to be mainstream.

A museum where the remnants of failed love stories take center stage. Personal items left by former lovers, each with poignant descriptions, offer a creative outlet for emotional healing. Unlike traditional approaches, this museum allows visitors to contribute to the collection, turning the pain of a broken relationship into a shared expression. Recognized for its innovation, it received the prestigious Kenneth Hudson Award as the most innovative museum in Europe. \n\nIt\'s not just a collection; it\'s a testament to the universal human experience of love and loss.

Discover the magic of mushrooms at Zagreb\'s Mushroom Museum! This unique museum showcases the world\'s most exposed lyophilized mushroom specimens. With about 1,600 different types categorized into edible, inedible, and deadly, it stands as the only museum of its kind globally. Thanks to Professor Roman Bo≈°ac, the Croatian father of mushroom farming, who dedicated his life to these fungi, you\'re in for a one-of-a-kind experience in the heart of the city. Don\'t miss the chance to explore this fungi wonderland! üçÑ

Welcome to this unique cafe, not just named for its proximity to the Botanical Garden, but crafted as a nurturing space for creative energy. More than a coffee spot, it\'s a haven for ideas, culture, and good vibes. Embracing transformation and change, the cafe boasts a lush environment filled with plants, an extension of the neighboring park. Reopened windows act as portals, blending the outside with the inside, creating an interactive space. \n\n Before obtaining catering permits, the cafe, operating as an association, hosted exhibitions, book promotions, designers, musicians, and even organized the vibrant Cabbage Fest ‚Äì a green festival merging education, art, and entertainment. Beyond stellar coffee, the menu features a variety of hot and cold drinks, natural juices, high-quality domestic wines, craft beers, liqueurs, and cocktails, each with a unique botanical touch.
